message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.CY. 

The paper discusses the use of Fog Computing-based infrastructure for Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITSs) and proposes a novel data offloading approach to ensure the security of the sensor data regularly off-loaded by each CAV. This involves the use of Random Linear Network Coding (RLNC) principle to minimize the probability of an eavesdropper to recover relevant portions of sensor data. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). Other likely sub-categories include cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.SY (Systems and Control), and cs.CY (Computers and Society).
